case_title: YAKOOB AND ANOTHER vs THE STATE
complaint_summary: On 15-06-1965, Loung, a fisherman, reported that Yaqoob and Rajab Ali assaulted his daughter Mst. Hajiani, attempting to kidnap and sexually assault her. Witnesses intervened, and injuries were sustained by Rabbu and Jumo during the scuffle.
investigation_summary: Police recorded statements, secured evidence, and referred injured parties to Civil Hospital, Thatta. Medico-legal reports confirmed injuries consistent with the allegations. Mashirnama of the crime scene was prepared, but one witness turned hostile and another was untraceable.
judgment_summary: The Sindh High Court upheld convictions for kidnapping, attempted rape, and assault but overturned convictions for house trespass under Section 452 due to lack of evidence. Sentences were maintained for other charges.
Decision_or_verdict: Appeal partly accepted; conviction under Section 452 set aside, other convictions upheld.
legal_arguments: Delay in lodging the report (7 hours)
Hostile witnesses and alleged false implication by Aqil Wadero
Judgment did not fulfill requirements of Section 367, Cr. P.C.
Improbabilities in choice of place of occurrence
Place of occurrence not established due to discrepancies

witness_statement.Mst. Hajiani: Described assault and attempted kidnapping by appellants.
witness_statement.Loung: Reported incident and injuries sustained by witnesses.
witness_statement.Ismail: Declared hostile; did not support prosecution.

key_issues: Improbabilities in choice of place of occurrence
Place of occurrence not established due to discrepancies

legal_terms.Mashirnama: Memo of description of the crime scene
legal_terms.Res gestae: Statements made spontaneously during the event

words_and_phrases.Attempted rape: Unsuccessful attempt to commit sexual assault

summary_vector_notes: Convictions upheld for kidnapping, attempted rape, and assault; house trespass conviction overturned due to lack of evidence. Witness credibility and alibi defense were key issues.

facts.location: Village Nahio Aqil, near a dry bed of a watercourse

injuries.Mst. Hajiani: Scratches on back, injury on thumb of right foot
injuries.Rabbu: Incised wound on left scapula, abrasions on left ear and temporal region
injuries.Jumo: Swelling on right and left arms

facts.medical_examination: Conducted by Dr. Muhammad Ibrahim; corroborated by Dr. Moeenuddin

points_raised: Judgment did not fulfill requirements of Section 367, Cr. P.C.
Improbabilities in choice of place of occurrence
Unexplained delay in lodging the report
Place of occurrence not established due to discrepancies
House-trespass conviction under Section 452 not applicable
court_findings: Place of occurrence established through witness testimony
Delay in lodging report not questioned during trial
Minor discrepancies in witness statements immaterial
No prejudice caused by dismissal of application under Section 540, Cr. P.C.
